intro: Pavetta haegarthii, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and are usually white or pale pink in color. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
